intro: Ceropegia ngomensis, commonly known as the Ngomeni moonvine, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers that are typically pale green to yellowish in color. The plant belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal regions. Its unique floral structure is adapted for specific pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance in its native environment.
